data.enText: opinion poll

data.chText: 民意测验；民意调查
data.enText: the process of questioning people who are representative of a larger group in order to get information about the general opinion

data.chText: 进行民意测验
data.enText: to carry out/conduct a poll

data.chText: 最近的调查反映民意有了出人意表的变化。
data.enText: A recent poll suggests some surprising changes in public opinion.
the polls

data.chText: 选举投票；计票
data.enText: the process of voting at an election; the process of counting the votes

data.chText: 投票结果将于明天公布。
data.enText: The final result of the poll will be known tomorrow.

data.chText: 英国传统的投票选举日是星期四。
data.enText: Thursday is traditionally the day when Britain goes to the polls (= when elections are held) .

data.chText: 投票于晚上9点结束。
data.enText: Polls close (= voting ends) at 9 p.m.

data.chText: 投票数
data.enText: the number of votes given in an election

data.chText: 工党的得票数领先。
data.enText: Labour is ahead in the poll.

data.chText: 他们得到了20%的选票。
data.enText: They gained 20% of the poll.

data.chText: 获得（票数）
data.enText: to receive a particular number of votes in an election

data.chText: 在上届选举中，他们获得了39%的选票。
data.enText: They polled 39% of the vote in the last election.

data.chText: 共和党在最近的选举中得票数都很漂亮。
data.enText: The Republicans have polled well (= received many votes) in recent elections.

data.chText: 对…进行民意调查
data.enText: to ask a large number of members of the public what they think about sth

data.chText: 民调中有超过50%的人反对拟议的军事行动。
data.enText: Over 50% of those polled were against the proposed military action.

data.text: election ♦ vote ♦ poll ♦ referendum ♦ straw poll ♦ ballot ♦ show of hands

data.chText: 以上各词均表示选举或投票表决。
data.enText: These are all words for an event in which people choose a representative or decide sth by voting.
election

data.chText: 指选举、推选，尤指政治选举：
data.enText: an occasion on which people officially choose a political representative or government by voting

data.chText: 上次选举中你把票投给了谁？
data.enText: Who did you vote for in the last election?
vote

data.chText: 指投票、选举、表决：
data.enText: an occasion on which a group of people vote for sb/sth

data.chText: 他们以投票方式决定谁先走。
data.enText: They took a vote on who should go first.
poll

data.chText: （新闻）指选举投票、计票：
data.enText: ( journalism ) the process of voting in an election

data.chText: 他们在投票选举中惨遭失败。
data.enText: They suffered a defeat at the polls .
referendum

data.chText: 指全民投票、全民公决
data.enText: an occasion on which all the adults in a country can vote on a particular issue
straw poll

data.chText: 指非正式民意测验：
data.enText: an occasion on which a number of people are asked in an informal way to give their opinion about sth

data.chText: 我在同事中很快做了一个民意测验看有多少人赞同。
data.enText: I took a quick straw poll among my colleagues to see how many agreed.
ballot

data.chText: 尤指无记名投票选举、投票表决：
data.enText: the system of voting by marking an election paper, especially in secret; an occasion on which a vote is held

data.chText: 领导者将通过无记名投票选举产生。
data.enText: The leader will be chosen by secret ballot.

data.chText: ballot通常用于机构内部的选举，而非公众的投票选举。
data.enText: Ballot is usually used about a vote within an organization rather than an occasion on which the public vote.
show of hands

data.chText: 指举手表决
data.enText: an occasion on which a group of people vote on sth by raising their hands
a national/local/federal/democratic/free/fair election/vote/poll/referendum/ballot
a presidential/parliamentary/congressional/council election/poll
to conduct a(n) election/vote/poll/referendum/straw poll/ballot
to have a(n) election/vote/poll/referendum/straw poll/ballot/show of hands
to hold a(n) election/vote/poll/referendum/straw poll/ballot
take a vote/straw poll/show of hands
a(n) election/referendum campaign/result/victory/defeat

tr: the counting of votes (as in an election)
the part of the head between the ears
an inquiry into public opinion conducted by interviewing a random sample of people
get the opinions (of people) by asking specific questions
vote in an election at a polling station

value.def: A poll is a survey in which people are asked their opinions about something, usually in order to find out how popular something is or what people intend to do in the future.

example.ex: Polls show that the European treaty has gained support in Denmark...
example.tran: 民意测验显示该欧盟条约已在丹麦获得支持。

example.ex: We are doing a weekly poll on the president, and clearly his popularity has declined...
example.tran: 我们每周就总统进行一次民意调查，很显然他的支持率下降了。

example.ex: The Socialist Party, which won a convincing victory in elections in June, has been losing support in the polls recently.
example.tran: 最近的民意测验表明，6月份在选举中大胜的社会党的支持率一直在下滑。

value.def: If you are polled on something, you are asked what you think about it as part of a survey.

example.tran: 超过1.8万人接受了民意测验。

example.ex: Audiences were going to be polled on which of three pieces of contemporary music they liked best...
example.tran: 将对观众进行民意调查，询问他们在3部当代音乐作品中最喜欢哪一部。

example.ex: More than 70 per cent of those polled said that they approved of his record as president.
example.tran: 超过70%的被调查者称对他总统任期的政绩表示满意。

value.tran: 对…进行民意测验（或调查）

value.def: The polls means an election for a country's government, or the place where people go to vote in an election.

example.ex: In 1945, Winston Churchill was defeated at the polls...
example.tran: 温斯顿·丘吉尔在1945年的大选中被击败。

example.ex: Voters are due to go to the polls on Sunday to elect a new president...
example.tran: 选民应于星期日前往投票站选举新总统。

example.ex: The polls have closed in the Pakistan parliamentary elections.
example.tran: 巴基斯坦议会选举投票已结束。

value.tran: 政治选举；大选；投票地点

value.def: If a political party or a candidate polls a particular number or percentage of votes, they get that number or percentage of votes in an election.

example.ex: It was a disappointing result for the Greens who polled three percent...
example.tran: 这个结果让绿党感到失望，他们只获得了3%的选票。

example.ex: The result showed he had polled enough votes to force a second ballot.
example.tran: 结果显示，他已获得了足够把对手拖入二次投票的票数。

trans: (在英国)通过单务契约(更名等)
